body_html: Well.... The script printed out a senetence to copy the dll from a source path and paste it into env variables path. I tried out the instruction of the script but nothing worked. After doing more research, I found that my PC(Windows 10) didnot have any gpus within and so I had to run the command - “conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu” by removing the pytorch version installed earlier for cuda compatibility. Things worked fine then onwards. Thank you peter. Great work setting up pytorch compatibility with windows.

Things worked fine then onwards. Thank you peter. Great work setting up pytorch compatibility with windows.
body: Well....  The script printed out a senetence to copy the dll from a source path and paste it into env variables path. I tried out the instruction of the script but nothing worked. After doing more research, I found that my PC(Windows 10) didnot have any gpus within and so I had to run the command - “conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu” by removing the pytorch version installed earlier for cuda compatibility. Things worked fine then onwards. Thank you peter. Great work setting up pytorch compatibility with windows.
